item.name: Ki-rin's Guidance
entries: The string is made from its hair, the riser is made from its carved horn, limbs made from its sculpted bones. A Ki-rin sacrificed itself so this weapon can be crafted and used to destroy a fiend.

When you lunch an arrow from this weapon, the arrow transforms into a {@spell guiding bolt|PHB} of light. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d6} radiant damage, and all your subsequent attacks from this weapon ignore the target's AC from their Dexterity modifier. On a critical success, further attacks automatically hit until either the target or you're unconscious.

item.name: Spirit String Bow
entries: This weapon doesn't have a visible string, but when you pull where would be a string, a string glows into existence. When the string is pulled all the way, an ethereal arrow forms. The arrows deal force damage instead of piercing. If you used an action to attack, you can fire another arrow using your bonus action as you don't have to spend time to get an arrow from your quiver. Arrows disappear a minute after they are fired.

item.name: Bow of the Twilight Valkyrie (ogd)
entries: A Twilight Valkyrie is said to walk the line between the light and the dark.
You can use your bonus action to switch between bow's celestial and infernal stances.

items: In celestial stance, the bow shines brightly and casts bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.
In infernal stance, the bow releases a dark smoke to hide you in the shadows. In dim light or darkness, you have +3 to Stealth checks

entries: Beware of the consequences of leaning towards one side too much.

entries.name: Curse
entries: Leaning towards one side particularly may have consequences.
Leaning towards the light side slowly burns your soul out and diminishes your spirit. You feel numb inside. On a critical success, deals {@damage 3d6} radiant damage both to you and your target.
Leaning towards the dark side corrupts your soul. You, constantly, feel agitated. On a critical success, deals {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage both to you and your target.

item.name: Razorwind
entries: It causes the air behind it to become as sharp as a blade. Arrows fired from this bow deal an extra {@damage 1d6} slashing damage and on a critical roll, causes the target to bleed for {@damage 1d4} damage per turn until it succeeds a DC equal to your Strength modifier + 10 Constitution saving throw repeated at the end of the target's turn.

item.name: Rifling Bow
entries: The bow has protrusions on its arrow rest. When released, an arrow starts to spin fast. If you hit, creatures directly behind are struck if your attack roll surpasses their AC, until a creature's AC from armor stops it.

item.name: Bastilla
entries: Using a bonus action, you can deploy the Bastilla's stand to gain +3 on your attack rolls. You can either deploy the Bastilla on a half cover sized object or choose to go prone to deploy it on the ground. Retracting the stand also requires a bonus action. Attack rolls have -3 while moving with the standout.

item.name: Rich Man's Crossbow
entries: This crossbow-like weapon uses pieces of currency as ammunition. The value of the coins themselves affects the damage output. Coins fired this way are destroyed.

items: cp {@damage 1d10} piercing
sp {@damage 1d10} piercing (silvered)
gp {@damage 2d6} piercing + {@damage 1d4} radiant
ep {@damage 2d6} lightning + {@damage 1d6} piercing

item.name: Venomous Hand Crossbow
entries: This magic crossbow carries a small system of curious tubes and vessels. It deals an extra {@damage 1d4} poison damage.

The crossbow has 4 charges and regains {@dice 1d4} expended charges daily at dawn. You can expend 1 of the weapon's charges when you make an attack with it to coat the fired bolt with a unique, self-generating venom. If the attack hits, the target takes an extra {@damage 3d6} poison damage and must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is poisoned until the end of its next turn

If you expend the crossbow's last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the vessels attached to the crossbow shatter and spray poison in a 25-foot-radius sphere centered on your location. Creatures within the sphere take {@damage 1d12} poison damage and must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. When this happens, the crossbow ceases to be magical and loses all of its additional properties.

item.name: Tethervine Quiver
entries: This seemingly overgrown quiver keeps a large plant magically concealed within. The quiver can store up to 20 arrows or bolts. When you draw a piece of ammunition from the quiver, you can speak the quiver's command word as a bonus action to magically connect the end of the ammunition to the plant inside the quiver. The plant is a rope-like vine that flies effortlessly behind a fired piece of ammunition. While wearing the quiver, you can use a bonus action to magically retract the vine up to 60 feet back into the quiver. Any object weighing less than 25 pounds that was hit by a connected piece of ammunition is pulled back toward the quiver when it's retracted in this way. Despite the quiver's limitations, the rope-like vine can hold up to 250 pounds on its own.

If you hit a creature with an arrow or bolt that was connected to the vine, the vine magically disconnects itself and falls from the ammunition. You can disconnect the vine from the ammunition by speaking its command word again or sever the vine from the quiver as a bonus action. Once severed, the vine is considered to be a mundane length of hemp rope.
You can only fire a connected piece of ammunition to as far as you have the vine. The quiver regrows 1d4 x 10 feet of vine each day at dawn, up to a maximum of 120 feet.

item.name: Titanfell
entries: An adamantine dagger with an onyx blade. It was crafted in Kravenforge, in an era where the titans were roaming the material plane, wrecking havoc. For once, in the entire history of existance, dwarves and giants worked together to forge this dagger.

It looks cool and that's it. It has no magic properties, detect magic has no effect on it, and identify reveals nothing. Until it's within 15 feet of a Large or larger creature. Then, the onxy grows. Depending on the size of the creature it grows to different sizes and deals different damage.

item.name: Betrayer's Blade
entries: A small dagger with a jagged black blade. You have proficiency(expertise if you're already proficient) on any stealth/sleight of hand check to hide it, and get a surprise round when attacking any non-hostile character.

The location of this dagger is currently unknown, but it is being sought in connection with the murder of a Count. If you have any information regarding its whereabouts, report to your nearest guard post for a reward of 20 gold pieces.

item.name: Haruspex's Blade
entries: As an action you can pierce your hand with this dagger for {@damage 1d4} piercing damage. You pick a type of saving throw and your blood sacrifice grants you a {@dice 2d4} bonus to that saving throw once in the next 10 minutes. You must use the bonus before you make the saving throw. You can't use this feature for 1 hour after you've cut yourself.

item.name: Poisoner's Needle
entries: A dagger, has a hidden compartment in the handle, in which 4 doses of poison can be stored. A small button secretes poison on to the blade as an object action.
The creature must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d4} poison damage. Also, the creature is poisoned until the end of their next turn regardless of the saving throw.
Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying.

item.name: The Annihilator's Fang
entries: A very large fang with a slight curve. In darkness, you can see shadows bend towards it.
If you try to throw it, it hangs in the air in front of you.

You can use your bonus action to command it with your mind. It has a flying speed of up to 40 feet, but it can only travel in a straight line that you can see during a turn and it can't go through creatures. It deals {@damage 1d4} force damage. You use your spellcasting modifier for both attack and damage rolls.

entries.name: Curse
entries: It channels The Annihilator's shadow to you, a shadow incarnate being, created to purge the material plane from its corruption. Wolven in form a gargantuan creature with green flames for eyes, an unending tongue, and seven chains attached to piercings on its body. After completing its purpose, it was chained in the material plane's depths by three {@creature solar|MM}s. The Annihilator attaches to you in your dreams, either trying to consume you or force you into spreading its shadows to gain its strength back.
If you accept to become its prophet, a sigil appears on your chest.

entries.name: Shadow Touched
entries: In darkness your entire body becomes swirled in shadows, granting you proficiency (expertise if you are already proficient) in Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

entries.name: Cult of Annihilaton
entries: You can turn a willing creature to a cult worshipper by extending your shadow. A small part of the sigil appears on their chest and their skin color darkens slightly.
For each sentient being you convince to join the cult, the sigil on your chest spreads with new runes.
The Annihilator is as strong as it has followers.
You are the prophet and don't count as a cultist.

entries.name: Offering to the Shadows
entries: Sacrificing worthy (living creatures with CR over 1) creatures with the fang activates the runes on your sigil. Activated runes glow dimly.
The maximum active runic charges you can have is equal to the cultists you have (i.e. runes you have).
You can use active runes to conjure special powers granted by the Annihilator. A used rune deactivates. Powers you can conjure are listed below.

items.name: 0 cultists
entries: You can infuse a spell attack with the Annihilator's shadow. With a cost of 1 runic charge, you add your spellcasting modifier to the damage of a spell attack.

items.name: 10 cultists
entries: As an action, you can summon up to two {@creature shadow mastiff|VGM}s (5 charges each). They stay with you for an hour, unless they drop to zero hit points, or unless you lose your concentration on this power. You mentally guide the summoned mastiffs, and they take actions in their own initiative together.

items.name: 20 cultists
entries: You can expend 2 runic charges and use your enemy's shadow against it.

You reach a creature's shadows with yours and grapple it until the start of your next turn. The creature can try to resist this effect with a Strength saving throw or an Intelligence saving throw (its choice), once when you first grapple it and again at the end of each of its turns.

items.name: 30 cultists
entries: While you're inside shadows or at most a dimly lighted area, as a bonus action, you can "{@spell blink|PHB} teleport". Doing so expends 3 runic charges.
You can travel up to 30 ft. through shadows and darkness to a place you can see at the location you've started.
You do not provoke opportunity attacks while you travel in this manner.
You cannot attack or take any other actions until you emerge from the shadows.
To the untrained eye, it looks as if you had teleported.

items.name: 40 cultists
entries: You can take a minute to detach your shadow from your body using a bonus action, creating a shadow clone. Doing so expends 10 runic charges.

Your shadow clone has the statistics of an {@spell Unseen Servant|PHB} and a shadow copy of everything you had equipped at the time of detachment, with two exceptions; the shadow clone can make weapon attacks with a bonus of +0 and the spell does not end when the shadow clone is 60 feet away from you. You can use an action to see through its eyes. After 10 minutes or when called, your shadow clone returns to you. If it drops to 0 hit points, you are left shadowless for the rest of the 10 minutes. While your shadow clone is active, if you drop to zero hit points, you switch bodies with the shadow clone. Doing so exerts the shadow clone immediately and restores you to the hit points your shadow clone had.

items.name: 50 cultists
entries: The Annihilator grants you a part of his own shadow

When you're mortally wounded you can forego 50 runic charges to become a shadow with 1 hit point for one minute. You're not invisible but cannot be interacted with. At the end of your reformation, you are fully healed and your spell slots and traits are restored as if you had completed a long rest.

items.name: 60 cultists
entries: You have +1 bonus to your spell attack rolls and spell save DC.

items.name: 70 cultists
entries: Serrations grow on the fang, increasing its die to a {@damage d6}

items.name: 80 cultists
entries: The fang twists and takes a slight helicoidal shape. Hits made with it initiate a bleeding effect. On a failed {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, the target takes {@damage 1d4} bleeding damage at the beginning of its turns until the creature succeeds, ending the effect.

items.name: 90 cultists
entries: The Annihilator provides shelter when you need one. You can take 1 minute to create a fane of the Annihilator. Doing so requires 10 runic charges.

The fane is a small temple. From outside it looks like a building made out of billowing shadows. The inside is an extradimensional dwelling that is 20-foot wide, 10-foot high, and 40-foot long, furnished with an altar of sacrifice, a large marble table, six alabaster chairs, an elevated brass brazier, and four torches to light the otherwise dark space.
An unwilling creature stabbed with the fang while laying on the altar must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be consumed. The creature has disadvantage on this saving throw.
You and any creature you designate when you conjure the fane can enter the extradimensional dwelling as long as its door remains open. You can open or close the door if you are within 30 feet of it.
The fane is immune to any damage.
After 24 hours the fane disappears, ejecting any creature still inside to the closest unoccupied space near its door.
When you conjure the fane again, you will always find it as you left it (i.e. if you leave an object inside, it will be there the next time you conjure the fane).

items.name: 100 cultists
entries: The Annihilator is unchained and set free, ready to  dissolve the material plane in its shadows and regain its might.
Unchain this creature to let it run its natural course and devour the plane, again!

item.name: Giant Axe
entries: A ludicrously oversized and unwieldy axe. You get -5 on attack rolls. It ignores AC from shields. A minimum of 14 Strength is required to lift it. If your size is larger than Medium, you only get -3 penalty.

item.name: Lightning Storm Gauntlet
entries: A gauntlet of black metal. Using a bonus action, you can charge the gauntlet with static electricity. When you hit with an unarmed attack you can cast {@spell shocking grasp|PHB}.

item.name: Gloves of Amphibios
entries: These gloves have 4 fingers but meld seamlessly into your hands when you don them. While wearing these gloves, climbing doesn't cost you extra movement, you gain a +1 bonus to Strength (Athletics) checks made to grapple a creature, you have swimming speed of 20 ft., and any creature grappled by you that is not wearing armor takes {@damage 1d4} poison damage at the end of each of your turns.

item.name: Spellscripter's Brace
entries: A long brown leather and blue cloth brace with cut fingers. When you attune to it two blue magical signs appear on your thumb and index finger.

This scripter's hand brace allows you to ditch your spell book. Instead, you can activate it to conjure a visual archive of spells which you can scroll through with your thumb and add or remove with your index finger.
As long as the brace is intact, your archive cannot be harmed.

item.name: Glove of Storing
entries: This device is a simple leather glove. On command, an item held in the hand wearing the glove disappears and and a crystal gem appears on one of the empty knuckles. The item can weigh no more than 10 pounds and must be able to be held in one hand. While stored, the item has negligible weight. With a snap of the fingers wearing the glove, an item of your choice reappears. A glove can only store 5 items that weigh 20 pounds in total. Storing or retrieving an item is a free action.

item.name: Repulsor Gauntlet
entries: This gauntlet is made of various pieces of leather sewn together with thick stitches with a large crystal disk fitted into the palm.

With this gauntlet, you can make a ranged spell attack against one creature you can see, within 10 feet of you. Although you are not proficient with it, you add your spellcasting modifier to attacks made with it. On a successful attack deal {@damage 1d6} thunder damage. Each consecutive hit made with the Repulsor Gauntlet increases the damage by an additional {@damage 1d6}. For example, if the Repulsor Gauntlet has been used 5 times, it will deal {@damage 6d6} damage on the next consecutive hit.

If you roll 1 on the attack roll, the attack backfires and the wielder takes the damage instead. If you roll 2, the disc bolts out and you have to use an action to mount it back on. It resets after a backfire, a disc failure, a long or short rest, or if you miss an attack.

If you manage to kill a creature with this weapon, the creature explodes and the creatures adjacent to the target take the same damage from the weapon. On a critical hit, the target is pushed back 5 ft.

item.name: Dwarven Fire Starters
entries: This metal "Knuckle Dusters" have a small level of infamy granting them the title of dwarven fire starters. Originally designed for a fist up in tavern brawls, they have become common in pugilist circles. Inscribed in dwarvish across the faces are "Fire" and "Pyre"

entries.name: White Hot
entries: Speaking the command words causes the knuckles to radiate intense heat and consumes 1 charge. This effect lasts for 1 minute or can be ended early at will. When activated, apply an additional {@damage 1d6} fire damage to all unarmed attacks.

item.name: Morningstar of the Dawn
entries: Can cast Searing Smite a number of times equal to the wielder‚Äôs proficiency, recharges {@dice 1d4} per dawn.

item.name: Chained Axes
entries: They are chained to your wrist and cannot be disarmed, but it takes an action to stow.
You can cast {@spell ensnaring strike|PHB} a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, with chains bursting from the ground to imprison your enemy. Recharges at dawn.

entries.name: Special
entries: You have disadvantage when you use Chained Axes to attack a target within 5 feet of you. Also, Chained Axes requires two hands to wield.

item.name: Night Song
entries: Deals {@damage 1d6} force damage to any creature it hits that has the "Incorporeal Movement" trait. Whet it does, a link is created between the axe and the creature, and the creature can't benefit from its "Incorporeal Movement" trait again until another target is hit with this weapon. After hitting a target, you can choose to root the target by anchoring the axe on the ground. Doing so, removes the target's damage resistances and prevents the target from teleporting or shifting to another plane by any means.

item.name: Chromatic Obsidian Handaxe
entries: This prismatic handaxe is made using chromatic obsidian, a dazzling type of stone found where several Elemental Planes meet. When you roll a 20 on an attack roll made with his magic weapon, the target takes {@damage 1d6} cold damage, {@damage 1d6} fire damage, {@damage 1d6} lightning damage, and {@damage 1d6} radiant damage. For each 6 you roll in this way, use the table below to determine which of the following effects happen.

rows: The target's speed is halved until the end of your next turn
The target takes an extra 6 fire damage at the end of its next turn
The target can't take reactions until the end of your next turn
The next attack roll made against this target before the end of your next turn has advantage.

entries: If you roll a 1 on an attack roll, the obsidian handaxe shatters and deals damage as if you rolled a 20

item.name: Flashstep Rapier
item.reqAttune: by a spellcaster with a Dexterity score of at least 13
entries: An elegant rapier, inlaid with elven engravings.

Whenever you're about to make an attack, you can dash 5 feet towards your target to close the distance, as a free action. You have to make an attack roll with the rapier after dashing to be able to do this. To the untrained eye, it looks like you've teleported. If you are directly dashing away from another foe, it has disadvantage on his opportunity attack.
Glows dimly green when used in this way and deals an extra {@damage 1d4} force damage.

item.name: Beacon Bow
entries: Used by the legendary wood-elf, Aela the Drow-Hunter, in her quest into the Underdark to retrieve her kidnapped husband. Nock an arrow and its head will ignite with brilliant radiance.
A Shortbow, doing {@damage 1d6} radiant damage, and casting Light wherever its arrow lands. On a critical hit, It blinds its target for 1 round, if the target fails DC 10 Constitution saving throw.

The creature can use their action to remove the arrow, or you may use a bonus action if you are within range. While the creature is under the magics effect, it cannot have any benefits from being invisible, hidden, or by being behind half cover.

item.name: Staff of Life
entries: As an action, you may call upon the arcane power of this staff. In a flash of light, two lemons appear.

item.name: Staff of Elementalist
entries: This staff has polychromatic opal stones attached at the tips. Each opal can hold one elemental's essence.

When an elemental with CR 5 or higher dies within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to capture the released energy from it. You can also, within the same reaction, release up to two essences from before to make room for the new ones.
The staff deals bludgeoning damage innately but you can change the damage type of the staff to one of the type of elementals you've captured.
You can use an action to conjure a CR 1 mephit according to the elementals contained.

items: Fire + Water = {@creature Steam Mephit}
Water + Water = {@creature Ice Mephit}
Air + Fire = {@creature Smoke Mephit}
Earth + Air = {@creature Dust Mephit}
Water + Earth = {@creature Mud Mephit}
Fire + Earth = {@creature Magma Mephit}

entries: Stored elemental energy is released and lost after a successful conjuring. You can only have one mephit bound to you. Conjuring another while one already exists, creates an unbound mephit.
A mephit conjured using this staff stays away from settlements. If you enter a settlement the mephit will leave you.

item.name: Spell Jammer
entries: An adamantine rod with a pointy tip on one end and a pearl on the other end.
You can jam it on the ground using an action and activate it using another action. It stays active for a minute or until you deactivate it using an action.

While it is active, any spell cast in the 60-foot radius below 4th-level disperses in the air and has no effect. It also disrupts all concentrations on spells. Creatures in the area of effect lose the effect of the concentrated spell. Creatures regain concentration at the end of the staff's effect or if they move out of the area of effect.
A creature who is about to cast a spell must roll an Arcana check against your spell save DC to notice the jammer effect. On a success, the creature can forego casting it.
It has 1 charge and you can replenish it by expending a 3rd-level or higher spell slot. Doing so costs an action

item.name: Hammer of the Farseer
entries: When you kill a monster with this weapon, you glimpse a random moment from its past. You may cast Augury once per day.

item.name: Grasping Whip
entries: When you hit with this weapon as a bonus action you can make a strength or dexterity contest to disarm or trip your enemy. You have disadvantage in this contest if disarming a two-handed weapon or tripping a creature larger than yourself.
Take care picking it up or its lash will snap to your wrist.

item.name: Glaive of Atlas
entries: Belonged to the first king of Atlantis, son of Poseidon, Atlas.
You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
While attuned to this Glaive, you gain the Powerful Build trait.
This weapon functions as a defender.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Special
entries: If you attack with a double-bladed glaive as part of the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it.

entries.name: Defender
entries: The first time you attack with the glaive on each of your turns, you can transfer some or all of the glaive's bonus to your Armor Class, instead of using the bonus on any attacks that turn. For example, you could reduce the bonus to your attack and damage rolls to +1 and gain a +2 bonus to AC. The adjusted bonuses remain in effect until the start of your next turn, although you must hold the glaive to gain a bonus to AC from it.

item.name: Kingsglaive
entries: A curved kukri, given to an elite group of soldiers who defend the royal family.

After a ranged hit with this kukri, you can use your object interaction to teleport to the location of your dagger. If you teleport to a distance at least 10 feet away, you deal extra {@damage 1d8} lightning damage and acquire the dagger.

item.name: Spiderbite Daggers
entries: These daggers are made using the harvested fangs of a large venomous spider. When you hit the same target on your turn with each dagger, that target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take an extra {@damage 2d4} poison damage and become poisoned until the end of their next turn.

item.name: Orcish Falx
entries: Does max damage against targets with under 11AC, or who are unarmored. Critical hits lop off limbs.

item.name: Angel's Will
entries: It's but a metal hilt which when you twist feather like plate metals align to make up the blade.
This greatsword was forged from an angel's left wing. It leaves a dim light where it cuts.

item.name: Heavy Repeating Crossbow
entries: A dwarven contraption that flings out bolts at a startling rate. It does {@damage 3d4} piercing damage and can attack twice per round. It costs 3 bolts per attack, and the crossbow has 12 bolts loaded. It costs an action and your movement to reload instead of having the loading quality.

item.name: Vampiric Trident
entries: Its tip is lined with teeth. When you hit a living creature with this weapon, you can use a bonus action to deal additional {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage, as the weapon bites into the target. You have to make a Charisma check against the target's Charisma Saving Throw. After this, you gain temporary hit points equal to half of the extra damage dealt.

item.name: Galepierce Trident
entries: Fine work of Atlanteans. This magic weapon has been tempered to glide through the wind, doubling both its normal and long throwing ranges. Ranged attacks made with this weapon against targets that are protected by fog, high winds, and other air-based hindrances are made without the normal disadvantage that those obstructions would typically cause.

item.name: Clockwork Bow
entries: This longbow has an assortment of gears and pulleys attached to it. Near the handle of the bow, there is a scope and a dial. This dial has three settings, Small, Medium, and Large.

If you are a creature who's size is the one the dial is set to, you have automatic proficiency with the bow. Additionally, you can use the scope to perfect your aim and spend a bonus action lining up your shot. You transfer your AC from your Dexterity modifier to your attack and damage rolls until the start of your next turn.
The bow can be folded up to be concealed as a bonus action, and you have proficiency (expertise if you're already proficient) on sleight of hand checks to hide the weapon when it is in this state.

item.name: Spiked Chain
entries: Weapon of the mighty goblin warlord Ulx.
Once you hit a creature, you can grapple it with a Strength check against the target's Strength saving throw. On a success, you can pull the creature up to 5 feet.

entries.name: Special
entries: You have disadvantage when you use  Spiked Chain to attack a target within 5 feet of you. Also, Spiked Chain requires two hands to wield and if you make an attack using your action, you can make another attack with your bonus action.

item.name: Double Knock Bow
entries: You can choose to fire two arrows simultaneously as if you were firing one, you fire with a -4 penalty but the damage is calculated for the arrows separately (both hit or both miss). You can target 2 adjacent creatures or one creature for both arrows.

item.name: Unzest
entries: A flail with runes on its head.

When you hit with this weapon, you can use a bonus action to suck the living force out of your target. The target loses two ability score modifiers of your choice that you gain until the end of your next turn.
It has 5 charges and regains {@dice 1d4+1} charges at dawn.

item.name: Hydra Flail
entries: This flail's spiked head is held in the jaws of a metal hydra figurehead. Whenever you take a critical hit, the weapon magically grows another spiked head. You gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls made with this magic weapon for each extra head the flail has, up to +6 bludgeoning damage. After 1 hour, any head the flail grows in this way falls off and disappears.

item.name: Inevitable Bow
entries: A nonmagical arrow or bolt fired from this magic weapon emits a fizzing red glow when it hits a creature. Only one creature can be so affected at a time. All your subsequent attacks from this weapon ignore the target's AC from their Dexterity modifier. When you attack a creature with the Inevitable Bow and roll a 20 on the attack roll, further attacks automatically hit until either the target or you're unconscious.

item.name: Bow of the Nymph
entries: Magical short-bow. The bow does not require ammo. When the bow is drawn without ammo, a magical arrow appears knocked in the bow.

Anyone struck by the magical arrow becomes charmed with the first creature it sees after being struck (as charm person‚Äîthe target must be a humanoid of Medium or smaller size, Wisdom DC 11 negates). The charm effects wear off after 1 minute. The magical arrow does not cause pain and is invisible unless detected by the Wisdom Save. The arrow disappears after the effect ends. The bow has 1 charge and recovers {@dice 1d2-1} charges at the end of a long rest.

item.name: The Rainbow
entries: All arrows shot with this bow leave behind a streak of 7-colored light. Which deals an extra {@damage 1d6} radiant damage. Once per day you can instead cause it to start raining as if a {@spell control weather|PHB} spell was cast.

item.name: Wind Walkers Bow
entries: An ornate silver bow. The string appears to shimmer with a blue light when drawn. This bow has 3 charges. When an arrow is fired from the Wind Walker's Bow you can choose to expend a charge as a bonus action and teleport to where ever the arrow makes contact. Teleport does not provoke opportunity attacks. Regains {@damage 1d4-1} charges every sunrise.

item.name: Blade of Selves
entries: While holding this weapon, as a bonus action, you may cast the {@spell mirror image|PHB} spell. When you cast {@spell mirror image|PHB} this way, it creates five illusory duplicates. Once you have used this ability you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Curse
entries: This weapon is cursed, and attuning to it curses you until you are targeted by the {@spell remove curse|PHB} spell or similar magic. When the {@spell mirror image|PHB} spell is cast from this item, roll a d20. On a 1, one of the illusory duplicates created is a full-grown clone inhabited by an evil-aligned soul and tries to take your place.

item.name: Faran
entries: When drawn out of its Burns dimly with purple fire. You can charge this weapon to create a crescent-shaped beam of force energy that travels for 15 feet in a 0.5 rad. cone.

item.name: Denier
entries: This magic weapon comes from a clan of Githzerai that debilitate their foes with strange magic.

When you hit a creature with the sword, you can expend 1 of its charges as part of the attack to force that creature to make a DC 13 saving throw of your choice. On a failed save, a creature is subjected to an effect based on the kind of saving throw it made:
This sword has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn.

items.name: Strength
entries: The creature gains a -2 penalty to attack rolls until the end of their next turn.

items.name: Dexterity
entries: The creature's movement speed is halved until the end of their next turn.

items.name: Constitution
entries: If the creature is Large or smaller, they lose their balance and are pushed 5 feet away from you.

items.name: Intelligence
entries: The creature has disadvantage on the next spell attack they make within 1 minute.

items.name: Wisdom
entries: The creature becomes slightly sluggish and can't take reactions until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Charisma
entries: The creature has disadvantage on attacks against creatures other than you until the end of its next turn.

item.name: Lady Luck
entries: A Shortsword with a blade of silver that critically hits on a 1. You have a +3 bonus to your attack rolls while you have under 1/2 of your maximum hit points.
Those who wield this sword tend to discover a latent love for games of chance.

item.name: Ice Sickle
entries: {@damage 1d4} slashing and {@damage 1d4} cold damage. On a hit, a target must succeed DC 10 Constitution to be able to use its reaction until the start of their turn. Its blade is a translucent shard of ice, and its handle is bone.

item.name: David‚Äôs Sling
entries: +100 damage on a hit against any creature larger than you, 5 non-replenishing charges.

item.name: Blowgun of Eternal Sight
entries: When you use a bonus action to awaken the magic inside this ancient blowgun, this powerful magic weapon gains 120 feet blindsight. It also knows the location of every creature and magical item inside the range. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until you lose your concentration.
You can use crushed pieces of paper instead of darts as ammunition.

item.name: The Judge
entries: Hits from this weapon cast {@spell sacred flame|PHB} upon the hit enemy. If you roll a 1 on an attack roll {@spell vicious mockery} is cast on you.

item.name: Agr'waendil
entries: This silver sword belonged to Agr'waendil, the worldwide champion of arenas, a peerles elf-goliath woman.

When you're holding this weapon with two hands and make an attack with it, choose any target within 5 feet, and it takes {@damage 1d6} slashing damage. This damage is considered magical in purpose of overcoming resistances.

entries.name: Curse
entries: Agr'waendil was killed iniquitously and she craves revenge. When you attune to this item, your mind is driven by vengeance.
If you can sate her vengeance, the extra damage increases to as many {@damage d4} dice as your proficiency bonus.
When you witness an unjust death, make an Intelligence saving throw. On a fail, your are bound to avenge them.
Take vigilance in your hands.

item.name: Half-forged Longsword
entries: In an attempt to create a sentient Longsword. A powerful wizard and a renowned blacksmith got together. While being forged it kept yelling "Harder!", "Right there!", and other kinky stuff. The blacksmith couldn't handle hearing it every time he hammered the sword and gave up. Deals {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning + {@damage 1d4} psychic damage. If you can please it enough it has +1 magic for a day.

item.name: Sword of the Defeated
entries: Once wielded by a hero of the land, this old and shattered blade is still as sharp as it was when it was forged. It's cold to the touch and the runes upon the blade glow white when drawn.

entries.name: Vailorn
entries: Once per day, you can speak to Vailorn for 10 minutes. Vailorn is a fallen hero whose soul has been trapped within the blade due to a curse. He relays to you that the only way to release his soul is to kill the creature that killed him and bound his soul to the blade.

entries.name: Vailorn Freed
entries: Once Vailorn is set free, blade's powers are unlocked.
Once per day, you can call upon Vailorn for aid. He will grant {@damage 1d8} psychic damage to attacks made with this weapon for 1 minute .

item.name: Akkadian Warhammer
entries: Blessed by Enlil. This weapon carries his perseverance. You can activate it using your bonus action. While you are holding it with two hands, next time you miss, {@spell erupting earth|XGE} spell is cast at the point of the target you were trying to hit. It has 5 charges and replenishes {@dice 1d4} charges at dawn.

item.name: Everglacier's Cold Fury
entries: This cold steel weapon from the Everglacier is topped with a menacing ice spike that never melts.

When you hit with an attack using this pike, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d10} cold damage. The weapon and its properties treat immunity to cold damage as resistance, and ignore resistance to cold damage.

When you reduce a Large or smaller creature to 0 hit points using this weapon, you can choose to encase that creature in ice. An encased creature is prevented from falling prone and is held in place by a shell of ice for 1 minute. If the creature is unconscious, it does not make death saving throws while it's encased in the ice. The ice has AC 12, 20 hit points, immunity to poison and psychic damage, and vulnerability to fire and thunder damage. If the encased creature is healed or the ice is destroyed, the ice crumbles and releases the creatures.

entries.name: Chillspike
entries: As an action, you can plunge the pike into the ground at your feet. When you do, the blade of the pike magically vanishes into the earth and summons up to three icy spikes from the ground nearby. Choose up to 3 different targets on the ground you can see within 20 feet of you. An affected target must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} cold damage as a frozen spike erupts from the ground beneath them. Immediately after using this property, the spikes recede into the ground, and the icy blade of the pike reappears.
It has 2 charges and replenishes {@dice 1d2-1} charges every day.

item.name: Chain of Reckoning
entries: It was used to chain a titan in Tartarus.
You have +2 to your checks made to grapple with this weapon.

entries.name: Judgment
entries: While you have an enemy grappled with this weapon, you can use your action to force Tartarus's calling upon them. On a failed Wisdom saving throw, the creature is forced to face their guilt and take {@damage 1d8} psychic + {@damage 1d8} fire damage. DC for this action equals to 8 + your Wisdom modifier or your Charisma modifier (your choice) + your proficiency bonus.
Once you use this on an enemy, they are immune to the psychic damage from this weapon.
It has 10 charges and recharges {@dice 1d10} charges every day.

entries.name: Special
entries: You have disadvantage when you use Chains of Reckoning to attack a target within 5 feet of you. Also, Chains of Reckoning requires two hands to wield and if you make an attack using your action, you can make another attack with your bonus action.

item.name: Achille's Spear
entries: A legendary spear with a shaft hewn from the wood of an ancient tree at the foot of Mount Celestia, and a head said to be forged by Hephaestus himself, this is a weapon for victorious heroes - and yet it has been responsible for as many terrible defeats.

The geometry and the material of this spear allows for a special stance. As a free action, you can assume this stance to get a +6 bonus to your attack and damage rolls until the start of your next turn. This stance requires you to expose critical points of your body. During this time window, any hit you receive is considered critical hit.

item.name: Crystalheart Spear
entries: Its iron was mined from the Shale Cavern of Dolhiem. When the miners couldn't separate the block of steel from the diamond, they forged around it.

When you hit, you can use a bonus action turn the spear's handle to shatter the diamond. Each turn, you can use your bonus action to draw energy from the splinters left inside the creature. On a failed DC 20 Constitution saving throw, the creature has 3 levels of exhaustion until the end of your next turn. You can repeat this until the splinters are removed from the creature somehow.
Once shattered, the diamond is no more. You can replace the diamond with a new one but the gem must be crafted into the spear.

item.name: Cu Chulainn's Spear
entries: A blood-red spear with relieves on it. Once a day you can infuse yourself with the speed and agility of Cu Chulainn and get a double action surge, meaning; you take two extra actions on your turn. You have to use all three actions to attack.
With this weapon, you add both your Dexterity and Strength modifiers to both your attack and damage rolls. Prerequisite: Dexterity 18, Strength 14

item.name: Mage Guardian's Greatsword
entries: Only the one who knows the ways of Mage Guardian can wield this sword.

This weapon absorbs the spells around. Whenever someone casts a harmful spell in 30 feet of you, it copies the damage type of the spell. When you hit, roll the dice for the damage again as the damage type it copied.

You can use your reaction to make an attack roll against any harmful spell that targets only you to block the spell entirely. You must roll higher than the attacker's roll or DC, plus the level of the spell.
Prerequisite: Strength 18, Intelligence 14.

item.name: Ghost Mail
entries: Scale mail that allows you to use a reaction to have a melee attack pass through you as if you were ethereal. Each use pulls you towards death, and next time you must make death saves you automatically fail one for each use of this item. If you survive, this is reset. Would likely only be used to avoid fatal damage. When the light shines just right on this armor's polished scales, tendrils of white mist can be discerned moving somewhere within.

item.name: Hide of the Winter Wolf
entries: The hue of this pelt draws up imagery of a frozen waste coated in snow or a harsh winter. The fine white fur is almost always chilled to the touch, only warming after prolonged contact. The size, texture, and snowy hue are all telltale signs of its origin as a pelt of a winter wolf.
While worn, cold damage you take is reduced by {@damage 1d8}.
This armor is considered cold-weather gear.

item.name: Scorpion Armor
entries: Crafted from the chitin of a giant scorpion. When you take a critical hit from a mundane attack, your blood splatters and deals the damage you took as acid damage to all enemies adjacent to you.
You are immune to poison damage.

entries.name: Curse
entries: While you wear this armor, it corrupts your blood with the venom of scorpion. Dark green veins show under your skin. Healing potions deal damage to you. You can instead drink poison potions to recover.

item.name: Bulette Armor
entries: This massive armor is composed of several layers of hide and armor pulled from its iconic namesake.
The massive upper skull of the beast acts as a hardened carapace over your head. The plating from the creature's exoskeleton forms a layer of armor across your body.
While unarmed and wearing this armor, you can take an action to assume the form of a bulette hybrid.
The armor grows down your arms, engulfing your arms as the skull lowers over your face.
While in this form, you gains a burrowing speed of 20 ft. and a tremorsense of 30 ft.

You can take the attack action with your new clawed hands but cannot grasp weapons or items. These claws do 1d10 slashing damage (you use your Strength modifier for attack and damage rolls), and these attacks are considered magical.
It takes an action to leave this form.
While attuned to this item, the user gains advantage on checks to know their direcion of travel and depth in subterranean environments.

item.name: Plate Armor of ogd
entries: This armor is but a single small shoulder plate.
As soon as you place it on your shoulder, flames of ... extends through your veins. It ataches itself by cauterizing your skin. Your fiery veins reach your neck and elbow.

item.name: Venombane Armor
entries: This spider hide armor absorbs poison and allows you to traverse webbed areas more easily. While you're wearing this armor, you can't be caught in webs of any sort and can move through webs as if they were difficult terrain. In addition, when you take poison damage while wearing this armor, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage by {@dice 1d8} + your Constitution modifier.

item.name: Darkwood Half Plate Armor
entries: This armor is made of darkwood, a light but dense wood that is as strong as steel and cannot catch fire. This armor weighs half as much as its mundane equivalent. You don't have disadvantage with Dexterity (Stealth) checks wearing this armor.

item.name: Darkwood Breastplate Armor
entries: This armor is made of darkwood, a light but dense wood that is as strong as steel and cannot catch fire. This armor weighs half as much as its mundane equivalent. Your AC equals to 14 + your Dexterity modifier.

item.name: Elven Chain
entries: Pinnacle of elven craftsmanship. You are considered proficient with this armor, even if you lack proficiency with medium armor. Your AC equals to 13 + your Dexterity modifier. This armor is concealed.

item.name: Ravenous Sentinel
entries: This armor is an enhanced mimic. When an incoming attack misses by between 1 to 4 points, tries to "eat" the metal weapon with an opposed attack roll against a DC equal to 10 + creature's proficiency bonus (magic weapons add their enhancement bonus squared to the DC). If a roll of {@dice d20} succeeds, the weapon is destroyed and the armor gains +3 magic bonus for 1 minute. The armor must be ‚Äúfed‚Äù daily or else it may try to eat nearby metal objects at random.

item.name: Armor of the Totem
entries: This suit of studded leather armor is made entirely without metal. Studs are made of polished ironwood. Buckles and clasps are crafted of carved bone, horn, and claw. When you use your Wild Shape ability, this armor changes shape as well, granting +2 AC while in animal form. Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

item.name: Juggernaut Plate
entries: Requires str 18, max speed 30ft, gives -5 to Dexterity saves while wearing, but allows a special {@action Attack} action.

entries.name: Charge
entries: Move 30 ft straight and make a Shove contest against all in the path of the last 20 ft., doing {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning to all who fail. You do not provoke opportunity attacks, and moving through enemy space is treated as normal terrain. You have resistance to mundane damage until the end of your next turn after Charge is initiated.
You have +5 to Athletics checks when charging.

item.name: Tabula Rasa ogd cold elemental?
entries: A white adamantine plate armor, fused with dragon bones which give it its color. When you kill an elemental of CR 5 or higher, a rune engraving related to the type of the elemental appears on the armor, giving you permanent resistance to the type of the elemental while you're donned.

item.name: Mirage Shield
entries: This is a shield that casts {@spell shield|PHB} on you. It has a rune engraved under its grip. When you follow the engraving with your finger using a bonus action, it lights up dimly and activates. Next time you are hit, light refracts from the shield and another shield appears in front of this shield. It has 2 charges which replenishe after a short rest.

item.name: Templar's Shield
item.reqAttune: by a Cleric or a Paladin
entries: This is a gold metal book, forged in the mines of Gal'badur.
The mines were overtaken by an undead plague. A cleric who was seeking shelter was tasked by Tharmekh√ªl himself to clense the mines. Tharmekh√ªl landed his light and knowledge to the cleric.
Upon repenting to Tharmekh√ªl, the book melts and attaches itself to your shield.
You are attuned to the shield at union spontaneously.
The shield grants you two extra Turn Undead casts per rest.
You know the {@spell identify} spell and can cast it as a ritual.

item.name: Anvil Plate Shield
entries: This was a metal plate that had been used to forge weapons and armor on it. Throughout time many metal pieces were beaten on it. Hundreds of different types of metal are infused into it, many of them being magical.

Raya Emberstone was trying to create the best shield in the city when she realized this metal plate is the hardest piece of metal she had. She worked on it for months, bending it to shape while bending her will to her ambitions. She then inoculated it with Moradin's breath. Fine particles of adamantine inside it accepted the enchantment.
While holding this shield, you have a +2 bonus to AC. This bonus is in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC.

entries.name: Retaliation
entries: Whenever a melee attack from a creature within 5 feet of you is stopped with this shield's AC (i.e. attacker misses you by up to 4 points), the shield erupts with sparks dealing {@damage 2d8} radiant damage. The attacker is blinded until the end of its next turn on a failed {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw.

entries.name: Moradin's Embrace
entries: This shield radiates fiery dim light for 5 feet from the outlines of the anvil engravings on it. You can use a bonus action to increase its radiance to bright light for 10 feet and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

The shield has 4 charges. You can use an action to expend 2 charges to cast {@spell wall of fire|PHB} from the shield (save DC 18). The {@spell wall of fire|PHB} spell lasts for 1 minute (no concentration required). The shield regains {@dice 1d4} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Rebuker
entries: This magic shield is forged by a mysterious group of Githzerai whose work is prized for its craftiness.

When you take damage from a creature you can see within 30 feet of you and are holding the shield, you can expend 1 of its charges as a reaction to reduce the damage you take by {@dice 1d6}. When you do, you choose an ability. Until the end of their next turn, that creature magically has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes of the chosen ability.
Once a creature has been affected by this property, they can't be affected by it again for 1 minute.
This shield has 3 charges and regains {@dice 1d3} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Band of the Shimmering Shield
entries: A brass armband that projects a disk of force, giving +2 AC, but leaving your hand free enough to still take the 'use an object' action.

item.name: Twitcher's Shield
entries: A shield made out of thick wooden sticks tied together with a leather strap as a grip.
This shield feeds from your fears. Whenever you're surprised you panic and raise your shield, gaining temporary hit points equal to 20 - your Wisdom score until the end of the surprise round.

item.name: Sage Bull
entries: A full metal shield with a large bull face ornament at the front.
This shield holds a maximum of 5 charges. It replenishes {@dice 1d4} charge every dawn.
Guiding Flame: You may expend 2 charges to have the guiding flame show you the level of danger in the direction you're pointing it at.

items: Green Flame - No Threat
Purple Flame - Low Threat
Red Flame - Medium Threat
Black Flame - High Threat.

entries.name: In Flames
entries: When melee attacked, as a reaction, you may expend 2 charges to attempt to ignite the attacking creature in flames. The attacking creature must make a DC 17 Intelligence saving throw. If they fail, they take {@damage 3d10} fire damage. If they are successful, nothing happens.

item.name: Mirrored Shield
entries: You can add your shield's AC bonus to any Dexterity saving throw you make against a projectile like spell that targets only you. If the attacker's roll equals your AC or spell's DC equals your Dexterity saving throw, it reflects the spell back at its caster.

item.name: Coralshield Golem
entries: This ancient golem is fashioned in the shape of a crab and made of a light but sturdy coral. While wearing it on your back, you can use a bonus action to instruct it to shield you. Doing so causes the crab to slowly move along your arm, and at the start of your next turn dons itself like an ordinary shield. Once equipped, you can instruct it to return to your back, doffing itself at the start of your next turn.

If you do not have a free hand or refuse to drop what you're holding when the crab attempts to don itself, it returns and re-attaches to your back at the start of the next turn, when it can be summoned once again. If the golem is removed from you against your will, it will slowly move toward you at a speed of 5 feet as it can see you.

item.name: Rho Aias
entries: This shield expands and gives a bonus equal to the number of enemies in 30 feet of you to your AC, starting from +0. For each expansion, you get -5 ft. to your speed.

item.name: Injection Arrow
entries: These arrow's heads are hollow and have storage equal to that of a vial. It contains a tiny mechanism similar to a syringe. You can use an action to prepare a syringe. Liquids held within never dry out, and are injected directly into a creature struck.

item.name: Void Arrow
entries: This pitch dark piece of ammunition is composed of densely packed shadows. A creature hit by this magic ammunition takes force damage instead of piercing damage. This ammunition makes no sound when it's fired or strikes a surface. It leaves no discernible wounds and vanishes immediately after hitting a creature.

item.name: Armor Piercing Arrow
entries: These arrows have very narrow metal tips, instead of a standard broad head, they appear much as a target arrow, but painfully sharp and heavier. Because of the small point of impact, the armor-piercing arrow can penetrate better through most armors. Wielding an armor-piercing arrow ignores up to 3 points of creature's AC gained from mundane armor.

item.name: Arrow of Transposition
entries: On-hit, the attacker and target immediately exchange positions, if they both can fit. If transposition is impossible, both take {@damage 3d6} force damage, and are returned to their original positions.

item.name: Hollow-point Arrow
entries: On-hit, the target must make a DC equal to your Strength modifier + 10 Strength save or be knocked prone. Damage dealt is Bludgeoning, rather than Piercing.

item.name: Mind Devouring Arrow
entries: These pale grey arrow tips are crafted from many {@creature Intellect Devourer|MM}'s spinal cartilage.

When you hit a creature with a ranged attack using this arrow, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d8} psychic damage and is forced to make a DC 15 Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is dropped to 0 Intelligence and stunned until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, the creature is not stunned and is immune to these arrows for the next 24 hours. A construct or undead creature automatically succeeds on the saving throw.

item.name: Arrow of Rest
entries: if it hits on a surprise round it casts Sleep on that target.

item.name: Witch Hunter's Arrow
entries: This arrow has an adamantine tip, a tiny pearl at the back, and a strand of adamantine wire connecting them inside the shaft.

When a creature is hit with this arrow, the creature loses all of their spellcasting ability. Any spell that is cast after being hit is ineffective. The creature also loses concentration on their spells.
The arrow can be removed using an action. At removal, the creature regains their concentration.

item.name: Horned Arrow
entries: Forged from the horns of slaughtered unicorns, each horned arrow is sentient with the soul of the unicorn it was crafted from. They remember how they died and how they were forged into the arrow. Over a long time, they are broken into Stockholm Syndrome.

As a bonus action, you may magically call all horned arrows back to you. An arcane unicorn embodies each arrow and they run back into your quiver. You gain +2 to your attack and damage rolls made with this arrow. These arrows cannot break as long as you are attuned to them.

item.name: What Ring?
entries: This ring has {@spell nondetection|PHB} spell cast on it by itself continuously.
Once a day you redirect {@spell nondetection|PHB} on your self.

item.name: Ring of Entrance
entries: This ring looks like a spider's skeleton, its legs wrapped around your finger.
When you kiss the ring near a door, the Skeleton Spider animates. It climbs into the keyhole and tries to unlock the door.
Make a spell attack roll. On a success, the door is unlocked.
It has 3 charges and replenishes {@dice 1d3} at dawn.
If you force the Skeleton Spider to unlock a door it has recently failed to, Skeleton Spider breaks.

item.name: Ring of the Mimic
entries: This ring may not shoot fireballs, but it never fails to impress shoppers. Once per day you may use the Ring of the Mimic to transform magically into an inanimate object within sight. This object can only be Tiny sized

item.name: Ring of Shark Detection
entries: Plays the Jaws music when a shark is within 60ft.

item.name: Exile's Ring
entries: An exotic ring with tiny chains circling it.
Once a day you can cast 4th-level {@spell banishment|PHB}.

entries.name: Curse
entries: It's cursed and cannot be removed. Once worn, whatever settlement you're in, you are magically exiled {@dice 1d6} days after from there. Reroll the die when you enter another settlement. You roll Wisdom Saving Throw with DC 10 to enter or stay in a settlement you're exiled. The DC increases each day by 1.

item.name: Ring of Greater Mage Hand
entries: It is said that some can manipulate the forces of nature. This ring is sure to increase your connection to the said forces.
This ring enhances your {@spell mage hand|PHB} spell. You know the {@spell mage hand|PHB} spell if you don't already.

items.name: Push
entries: You can push your enemy a distance equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

items.name: Pull
entries: You can pull your enemy a distance equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

items.name: Levitate
entries: The weight your {@spell mage mand|PHB} can carry is increased by your spellcasting ability score in pounds.

item.name: Ring of Entropy
entries: When you roll a critical fail, your next roll is a critical success, vice versa. The second critical success/fail generated by the ring doesn't charge the ring again.

item.name: Heart of Hydra
entries: A red gold ring. Protects you from a failed death saving throw once, then shatters.

item.name: Seal of Gal'badur
entries: You can wear it to gain advantage on Charisma checks against dwarfs.

item.name: Ring of Alucard
entries: Whenever you deal melee damage to anything that isn't undead or a construct, you gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.

This ring has 10 charges. As part of a melee attack, you can expend 4 charges to gain hit points equal to the damage you dealt. It recharges using your blood. Roll {@dice 1d8}'s as many as your level, take the result as necrotic damage, for each charge restored.

item.name: Bands of Amend
entries: Two interlocking bands, one gold engraved with motifs of Justitia and the other granite with motifs of Arete.
Justitia rewards order with temporary hit points equal to your level and punishes chaos with Shocking Grasp.
Arete rewards goodness with inspiration and punishes evil with a Sacred Flame.
Once worn, only a royal blood can unequip it from you.

item.name: Band of Atonement
item.reqAttune: by a Creature of Chaotic Alignment
entries: A leather wristband with 8 small circular runes on it
Each rune heals the wearer for {@dice 1d8}.

entries.name: Curse
entries: Upon wearing it, roll a Wisdom check. DC is designated by the chaos you have accumulated. On a fail, you are cursed and cannot remove the band. On a success, the band has neither effect nor any healing power and can be removed.
Your acts on the righteous path grants you rune charges.

entries.name: Mind Lull
entries: You lose the temptation for the chaos inside you. Your emotions are calmer and your mind focused on the righteous path. Before acting in a mischievous way you must pass a Wisdom check. On a fail, your mind is blanked and you cannot continue your act.
If {@spell remove curse|PHB} is cast on you, the ring ceases to function.
"For you have sinned, you must atone.
Your chaos shall cease. Your emotions shall go quiet.
Your passion shall soothe.
Worry not, for I shall cleanse you from the chaos inside."

item.name: Mask of Confidence
entries: An ornate mask, like those worn for masked balls. The wearer hears a constant stream of sycophantic praise. Allows you to cast {@spell charm person|PHB} spell once a day.

item.name: Mask of the Pact Bearer
entries: This mask appears like a normal wooden mask before you attune to it. When you attune to this mask, your otherworldly patron's presence over you magically reshapes it to represent the visage of your patron. While you wear this mask, you can cast one spell from your patron's expanded spell list without expending a spell slot. The spell must be of a level equal to or less than your warlock spell slot level. A spell cast in this way is always cast at its lowest level, regardless of your normal warlock spell slot level. Once the mask has been used in this way, it can't be used again until the following dawn.

item.name: Dancing Shoes
entries: When an attack misses you, you may move 5ft as a reaction. If you chose to move "U can't touch this" starts to play.
Float like a butterfly, sting like a bee.

item.name: Achilles' Heal
entries: These boots have 3 charges which refresh at dawn.
When you use any type of healing that requires die roll, you can expend a charge and reroll a die once.

item.name: Babel‚Äôs Ornament
entries: An earring that translates all languages.

entries.name: Curse
entries: Sometimes lies and causes mischief.

item.name: Belt of the Last Man
entries: Gain +1 AC for each PC party member that is unconscious, with the effect ending if they die or wake up.

item.name: Mirror of Imprisonment (ogd, too op, too boring, can be salvaged)
entries: The mirror was used in the days of old to trap an immortal evil. Once the creature was captured, the heroes attempted to destroy the mirror to kill the creature, needless to say, they failed.
This item requires attunement, to attune to this item, you must speak the true name of the last creature you killed. When attuned, you gain the following:

items: You gain a bonus +4 to your charisma to your modifier.

items.name: Scrying
entries: Once per long rest, you may cast {@spell scrying|PHB}

entries.name: Curse
entries: This item is cursed. Upon attunement, you must look into the mirror at every dawn or take {@damage 12d10} magic damage. Every time you look into the mirror, you are shown how one of your friends or family member will die. The mirror, however, will sometimes show the truth or a false vision. At the end of every vision, you must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 19), if you fail, you take 3d10 psychic damage. The only way to unattune to this item is you must save someone from their deathly fate you have been shown.

entries.name: Death's Whisper
entries: This mirror is sentient with a trapped lesser demon.

item.name: Chalice of Hestia
entries: Whitish gold chalice inlaid with red gems. Red gems are carved to resemble flames.
The chalice imprints on you. It only works while you are holding it.

Whatever liquid you fill it with turns into wine. If you sing love songs or read love poems to it while filling it, the quality of the wine increases. While you drink from the chalice, you can taste her lips. If you go to bed drunk with the wine, Hestia, the virgin goddess of the hearth comes to you in your dreams.
You have +2 bonus to your spell attacks.

entries.name: Curse
entries: If you have sex/romance with any others, Hestia will get jealous. The wine will turn into blood and you'll lose the items's magic bonus.

item.name: Cloak of the Matador
entries: As a reaction, you may have an enemy attack against an ally within 5ft of you target you instead. If you took the dodge action on your turn - possibly causing it to miss.

item.name: Mantle of Misfortune
entries: When you roll 1 on a {@dice d20}, your mantle spreads the effect. Until the start of your next turn, any creature within 60 feet must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the result from any attack rolls, ability checks or saving throws.

item.name: Ratskin Cape
entries: A long cape seemingly made of rat fur, secured around the neck with a rat skull clasp. It's quite warm but also disgusting. It seems to wriggle and writhe of its own accord, and no matter how often it is washed, it reeks of... well... rat.

Once per long rest, you can throw it on the ground and it turns into a {@creature swarm of rats|MM} that will attack whatever creature is in the space it landed in. The rats revert to cape form if the target creature dies or leaves the space. There are 24 rats in the swarm, one for every hit point; for every point of damage taken, a rat is killed. When the swarm reverts to cape form, it is reduced in size (for example, if half the rats are killed, the cape is now half the length it was before). If all the rats are killed, all that will remain is the clasp.
If the cape (or clasp) is left out with a lump of cheese in an area frequented by rats, it will add one new rat every hour, until it is restored to its 24-rat maximum.

item.name: Pouch of Replenishment
entries: This pouch holds a maximum of 3 potions. At the beginning of a long rest, you may choose to activate the pouch's magic. Should there be any empty common, uncommon or rare potions within the bag during a long rest, roll {@dice 1d4}. If you roll a 1-2, they are magically destroyed and the maximum number of potions the pouch can hold is lowered by 1. If you roll a 3-4, they are magically replenished.
Until the pouch is opened the potion is both full and destroyed.

item.name: Goblin's Gourd
entries: This gourd is covered in primitive carvings and decorations. It is accented by a cork stuffed with grass and weeds to seal it shut. Upon removing the cork, the interior reveals a noxious smelling, thick substance that is almost unnaturally sticky. Made through a combination of goblin alchemy if crushed fermented plants and other natural waste, this gourd seem to be a mainstay among their culture.

entries.name: Ingestion
entries: When consuming this potion, roll a Constitution saving throw with a DC 8. This DC increases by 2 for each consumption within a 24-hour span.
On a failure, you become {@condition poisoned} for {@dice 1d6} rounds.
On a success, you regain hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Constitution modifier.

entries.name: Thrown
entries: After a successful ranged attack, if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must make a Strength saving throw DC 10.
On a failure, the target is {@contidion restrained}. It can spend its action to attempt to break free by rerolling the save, this effect lasts {@dice 1d4} rounds.
Any goblinoid type creature lowers listed DCs by 2 and only adds +1 for each additional usage due to familiarity and use.

item.name: Potion of Shadow Form
entries: This potion's container seems to hold a black fog that moves and pours like water.

When you drink this potion, you and everything you are carrying turn into a shadow for 1 hour. In this form, you are immune to being grappled and restrained, and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons, but you are vulnerable to radiant damage. You can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing. When you're in dim light or darkness, you add your Dexterity modifier twice to your Dexterity (Stealth) skill rolls and can take the Hide action as a bonus action. Finally, you gain Darkvision to 60 feet, if you didn't have it already. However, you can't manipulate objects and can't attack anyone except for other creatures made of shadows, including other creatures who have consumed this potion, creatures such as shadows or shadow demons, and creatures native to the Shadowfell.

item.name: Potion of Hydrate Person
entries: This potion has no color, smell, or taste. It is not magical.

item.name: Potion of Nightshade
entries: This purple potion is the bane of vampires. When you drink this potion, your blood becomes toxic to vampires. Any vampire drinking your blood takes 3d6 acid damage or half as much damage on a successful DC 20 Constitution saving throw.
A vampire can drink this to commit suicide. It deals 20d20 poison damage or half as much damage on a successful DC 20 Constitution saving throw.
The potion can also be applied to weapons and ammunation as oil. A weapon coated in Nightshade oil deals an extra 3d6 poison damage to vampires.

item.name: Aged Goodberry Wine
entries: This bottle of thick red wine is miraculously made from magical goodberries and peonies using a closely-kept family recipe. It tastes fruity and floral, with notes of honey and the feeling of a fresh breeze, and is deeply rejuvenating. The bottle comes with 7 servings of the syrupy potion. A serving takes 1 minute to drink.
When you drink this wine, you can regain hit points by spending one Hit Die per shot, as if you'd finished a short rest.

item.name: Potion of Minor Errands
entries: It's a very clear looking liquid. Tiny sparks are seen inside frequently
When you drink this potion, you gain an additional bonus action on each of your turns for a minute.

item.name: Potion of Sight
entries: This potion's container seems to hold a very thick black goo. Drinking it gives you black eyes.
When you drink this potion, you gain {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 30 ft. for 1 hour.

item.name: Kraken Blood
entries: Actually, made from mushed Juvenile Kraken eye but "Kraken Blood" sells better.
When you drink this potion, your eyes glow with a bright orange for the duration.
You receive a total of 3 Legendary Actions which can be used within the next minute, all unused Legendary Actions fade away after this time.

You can use a Legendary Action at the end of the turn of any other creature in the initiative order. You can use a maximum of one Legendary Action each round. To spend a Legendary Action you can do anything which would require a single Bonus Action or an Action to perform.

item.name: Eldritch Scarf
entries: This dark, silky scarf moves slightly on its own in a breeze that no one can feel and absorb more light than it reflects.

The scarf has an extradimensional space within the folds of its fabric that can only be reached while it's worn. The space holds 60 pounds of material, not exceeding a volume of 6 cubic feet. The scarf always weighs 1 pound, regardless of its contents.

Despite being able to place items in the scarf, reaching back into it fails to return them to your grasp. The frayed ends of the scarf are actually wisp-like hands that slowly twist and curl on their own. While wearing the scarf, you can mentally command the hands as a bonus action to reach into the extradimensional space and retrieve a stored item.
Placing the scarf inside an extradimensional space created by a "bag of holding", "portable hole", or similar item instantly destroys both items and creates a singularity.

item.name: Belt of Returning
entries: A finely crafted dark leather belt with three loops, each decorated with a shard of sapphire.

The magic of the belt leaves an invisible mark on the surface of the weapons stowed in each loop and invisibly inscribes the name of the item on the sapphire shard. Three one-handed weapons with the thrown property can be 'attuned' to the belt.
When a weapon, from the belt, is thrown at an object or creature, hit or miss, the weapon will return to the belt at the end of your turn.

item.name: Eye of the Fiendlord ogd
entries: While you are attuned to the eye, once a day, you can cast see invisibility on yourself at will. You can choose to see through its magically enhanced lens using a bonus action.
Looking through the eye grants you darkvision of up to 120 feet, and are able to peer through both magical and nonmagical darkness using it.

entries.name: Curse
entries: When you attune to the Eye of the Fiendlord, you are suddenly overcome with the urge to see what it sees. Make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw. On a success, you're able to resist the enchantment and are aware of the curse's effects, but are not attuned to it. On a failure, you forcefully tear out one of your own eyes, taking {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage, allowing the Eye of the Fiendlord to crawl into its place. If you are already missing an eye, you are simply compelled to allow the eye to crawl into the empty socket.

You can see normally while the Eye of the Fiendlord remains in your socket, but you can choose to close your other eye to see through its magically enhanced lens using a bonus action. The eye moves slower than a normal eye, leaving slight trails and motion blurs behind it as you look through it. While looking only through the Eye of the Fiendlord, you have disadvantage on any attack you make as well as ability checks that rely on depth perception. You can open your other eye and regain your normal vision using another bonus action.

entries.name: Familiar
entries: The eye is a gruesome familiar. As an action, you can command the eye to crawl out of its socket and move independently of you. Use the abilities described in the {@spell find familiar|PHB} spell when commanding the Eye of the Fiendlord. The eye has five hit points, an AC of 12, movement and climbing speed of 20 feet, does not require air to breathe and has a +6 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks. If the eye is slain or you dismiss it, it reappears inside your open eye socket with a sickly sound. If it was slain, you cannot use its magical sight or command it as a familiar again until the following dusk.

Targeting the eye with the {@spell remove curse|PHB} spell or unattuning to it causes the eye to pull itself out of the socket and crawl away. Slaying the eye while it is unattuned to a creature destroys the item.

item.name: Red Claw's Regalia ogd
entries: This tough dragon scale robe is miraculously insulated and comfortable. While wearing the robe, you gain the following benefits:

items: You can withstand extreme temperatures without any additional protection.
Your Constitution score increases by 2, to a maximum of 22.
You have resistance to fire damage.
You can walk on lava as if it were solid ground, without taking fire damage from it. Ending your turn on lava causes you to sink into it and take fire damage as normal.

entries: The hem of this robe glimmers with slowly shifting embers. While wearing this robe, your steps leave behind small motes of magical fire and scorched earth. The flames and marks left behind are harmless and disappear 1 second after they appear.

item.name: Wrath of Zeus
entries: Gold plate bracers. On a roll of 9 or 11, your unarmed strike explodes with {@spell thunderclap|XGE}. On a roll of 10, it backfires and you take {@damage 1d6} lightning damage. The spell's DC equals to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier.

item.name: Mage Guardian's Helm
entries: A full plate helmet without any openings. While you are wearing it, you are blinded, deafened, and mute. If you know the ways of Mage Guardian, you can activate the helm's 60-foot Truesight. Provides resistance to psychic damage, {@spell charm person|PHB} and {@spell sleep|PHB}.

item.name: Webgrip Rucksack
entries: This spider leather bag is lined with a thin layer of adhesive web.

Items stored inside the bag are held in place by the web, preventing stored items from clattering around or being removed without permission. While you're wearing the bag, creatures other than you have disadvantage on Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks to steal from the bag. The bag and its eight straps adhere to the surface they're pressed against, such as a creature's torso or the wall of an inn. If you're wearing the bag, you can gently remove the straps from your body as an action. Other creatures that attempt to wrench the bag from you make any Strength checks to do so with disadvantage.

The bag can hold up to 8 cubic feet or 80 pounds. Spider leather is pliable and stretches easily, allowing the bag to shrink and grow to accommodate the objects placed inside to some degree. Even though the eyes adorning the bag are lifeless and unmoving. they still blink on a rare occasion.

item.name: Swiss Army Wand
entries: You're not sure who the Swiss are or why an army would need such a non-aggressive wand, but it seems useful enough. Never Leave Home Without It. This wand has 10 charges and it regains {@dice 1d6+1} expended charges daily at dawn. You can expend 1 or more charges to cast one of the following spells from the wand:

item.name: Wand of Magic Missiles
entries: While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spell magic missile|PHB} spell from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 1st-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend. The wand regains {dice 1d6+1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

item.name: Clockwork Faefly
entries: This bronze clockwork mechanism is 2 inches long and has a glass vial under it. It whirs with the hum of tiny gears inside.
You can tap the head of the faefly twice as a bonus action. When you do, the mechanism flutters 5 feet in the air and emits the {@spell light|PHB} spell.

The faefly has AC 15 and 10 hit points and flies in this way until it falls to 0 hit points or another creature grasps it. If you move more than 3 feet from the hovering faefly, it follows you until it is within 3 feet of you.
If the {@spell mending|PHB} spell is cast on the faefly while it has at least 1 hit point, it regains {@dice 2d6} hit points. If the faefly drops to 0 hit points, it can't be used again.

item.name: Clockwork Healerbee
entries: This pill-shaped magical mechanism is 2 inches long and made of brass. It has a pair of tiny wings that silently keep it aloft. It hovers up to 5 feet above the ground and does its best to stay at your side within your space.

The bee has 8 charges and regains {@dice 1d6+2} expended charges daily at dawn. While the bee is within your space, you can speak its command word and expend up to 3 of its charges as a bonus action to command the bee to heal a creature that you can see within 20 feet of you. The bee flies to the creature's space and stings the creature, casting a {@spell healing word|PHB} for each expended charge. After healing the creature, the bee returns to your space.

It has AC 15, 10 hit points, and has resistance to all damage types. If the {@spell mending|PHB} spell is cast on the bee while it has at least 1 hit point, it regains 2d6 hit points. If the bee drops to 0 hit points, it can't be used again.

item.name: All-In Coin
entries: On a roll you would normally use a {@dice d20}, flip a coin instead. Heads is a critical success, tails is a critical fail. It has one charge and refills when you roll 20 or 1 naturally.

item.name: Blessed Coin
