entries: A bronze colored coin. Flipping the coin causes it to disappear, turning into dust. If it lands on heads, you may add 1 to any roll you take in the next 10 minutes. You may only do this to one roll. The "charge" is stored in the character for 10 minutes, similar to a bardic inspiration. You can not stack this ability on more than one roll at once, but you may hold more than one charge at once.

item.name: Hymn of Zeus
entries: A prayer book that gives +2 on Religion checks when held. Has one charge of {@spell call lightning|PHB}.

item.name: Opus of Poseidon
entries: Written by Poseidon himself. First users of the tidal magic were taught by this book. Generations have practiced these spells to carry Poseidon's will.
It needs to be soaked in saltwater regularly or the pages will dry out and fall, losing spells.
It has 8 charges and regains 1 charge on each ebb and flow cycle.

entries.caption: Spells Contained in Opus of Poseidon

item.name: Wand of Secrets
entries: While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges, and if a secret door or trap is within 30 feet of you, the wand pulses and points at the one nearest to you. The wand regains {@dice 1d3-1} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Whistle of the Meadow Genie
entries: Carved by a druid of the old ways. This whistle makes the sound of the spring winds when blown.

entries.name: Bloom
entries: Once per day, as a bonus action, you may blow this whistle to activate its magic. All flowers within 100 ft. of you bloom to life. Healing all friendly creatures within 20 ft. of you for {@dice 1d6} + your Wisdom (Nature) modifier.

item.name: Sheath of Bond
entries: The sheath magically adjusts its shape for any weapon you sheath into it.

During a long rest, you can sheath a melee weapon in it, speak its command word and bind the weapon to the sheath. As a bonus action, you can re-summon your bound weapon into the sheath, whilst the weapon is in a 30 ft. range.
There can only be one bound weapon at any time. If the bound weapon gets destroyed, the bond breaks. The bound weapon does not use your attunement slot while bound to the sheath.

item.name: Archmage Krylles‚Äô Instant Campsite
entries: Throwdown this magical pack and have a furnished 4 man tent appear, with a fire pit and roaring fire, and a pot of water on the boil.

item.name: Consolation Medallion
entries: A bronze medallion with red and white strap.
You can expend any number of charges it has to increase your roll by that much. It recharges 1 charge when you roll 1 on a die up to 20 charges.

item.name: Blood Pact Pendants
entries: These iron pendants come in pairs and are connected by a powerful bond of self-sacrifice. In order to create this bond, you and a friendly creature with whom you are close perform a brief, 1-minute ritual to connect your destinies and forge a blood pact. When you create this blood pact, you must each agree on a number of hit points to permanently sacrifice, reducing your total maximum hit points (minimum 1). Once a pact has been forged, trickles of the bound creatures' blood are absorbed into the normally clear gem adorning the face of this pendant. While the gem is filled in this way, it seems to gently swirl and pulse in time with your heartbeat.

While each bound creature is wearing their pendant and both are on the same plane of existence, they're protected by this pact so long as one creature is still conscious. When a bound creature dies, they're immediately revived with {@dice 2d10} hit points plus twice the number of hit points previously sacrificed by the creature. When a creature is revived in this way, the other bound creature immediately falls to 0 hit points and is knocked unconscious. This property ignores any effect that would normally prevent a creature from falling to 0 hit points. When this happens, both creatures' maximum hit points are returned to normal. Once the pact is ended in this way, the gems and pendants crack and are no longer magical.

item.name: Golden Scarab Pendant
entries: The pendants is stunning in its craftmanship, with twisting golden arcs forming the curvature of its body and head and delicately set sapphires in its eyes.

Multiple creatures can be attuned to the same pendant. Anyone attuned to the pendant is in its favor unless they do something directly destructive to nature or do something truly evil in its presence, at which time the attunement is lost.

entries.name: Lifegiver
entries: When anyone attuned to the pendant dies within 60 feet of it, the scarab unhooks itself from its chain and flies to them instantly, spreading its wings with brilliant flash of green that heals them for a number of d4s equal to the number of creatures attuned to it within 60 feet
Once this ability has been used, the beetle must spend an hour under direct sunlight to recharge this ability.
When left unchecked in shadows at day time, animates and crawls towards sunlight. Then, petrifies back under sunlight.

item.name: Iuz Stone
entries: Dark crimson crystal, looks as if it is almost bleeding.
When simply held by a dread, it rejuvenates half of its missing hit points.

entries.name: Curse
entries: For each round it is held, holder is shown a different flash and it drains 1 maximum hit point permenantly.

items: First round, Graz'zt and Iggwilv together.
Second round, visual incarnation of pain and suffering.
Third round, Iuz's old human form.
Fourth round, Iuz's seven feet tall demonic form.
Fifth round, an empire of slaves.
Sixth round, a lich-god with a partially shattered eye
Seventh round, a war of empires
Eighth round, Iuz's empire's demise.
Ninth round, a city of skulls.
Tenth round, Iuz slaughtering traitors.
Eleventh round, Iuz ploting from the shadows.
Twelfth round, Iuz corrupts humanoids with hatred.

item.name: Liquid Focus
entries: You can mix and match your available spell slots. Expending a level 3 and a level 4 spell slot, you can cast a spell at level 7.

item.name: Accelerator Gem ogd
entries: Increases the range of your spells by 15 feet with the exception of spells with the range of touch.

item.name: Academic Focus
entries: An orb that functions as an Arcane Focus, giving -5 to Passive Perception, but proficiency (expertise if you are already proficient) on Arcana checks. You can cast {@spell legend lore|PHB} as a 4th level spell, and {@spell identify|PHB} without expending a spell slot. These spells are added to your spell list if you do not already know them, and they do not count against spells known.

item.name: Adamantine Focus
entries: It acts as a conduit between you and your target. You can expend a spell slot and lend a spell of your choosing to an ally. For the next hour, your ally can cast the spell using the spell slot as an action.

item.name: Pearl Focus
entries: Amplifies your spells. When used; the level of the spell you are casting doubles but strains your physical and spiritual form. With each use, a part of your soul is consumed. You gain 1 exhaustion and your maximum hit points are reduced by 1.

item.name: Horadric Cube ogd
entries: It's a hand-sized cube with engravings on it. The cube can merge the same type of magical items into greater ones.
If you touch any item to one of its sides, the item is diffused into it. You have one minute to insert the rest of the items. Otherwise, all items are ejected from it.
The time required for this process is equal to the rarity level x 10 hours. Place 5 of the same item inside the cube, lock the cube and then wait.
Some examples include: 5 +1 Longwords can be merged into a +2 Longsword within 20 hours, 5 Potions of Healing can be merged to a Potion of Greater Healing within 10 hours.

item.name: Instant Trap Tube
entries: This small cylinder seemingly has no bottom if viewed from its openings. If the owner stuffs a disassembled trap and a copper piece (it expects labor compensation for some reason) into an open end a small ball pops out from the opposite end. The traps appear as palm sized balls that can be thrown (20ft) and adhere to the surface they land on before melding almost perfectly and blending in with the environment.

item.name: Tome of Mage Guardian
entries: This book is written in elder language and belongs to an over eight thousand year lineage of Mage Guardians, magically enhanced Eldritch Knights, Magi. They have been accompanying archmages for generations. When there are no archmages to protect and serve, they are sent into hibernation. Only the aura of a powerful mage can wake them up.

The book has one purpose, passing ancestral knowledge and power of the guardians along. At least 14 Intelligence is required to understand it. Once you read this book, what you can make up of it grants you:

items: A cantrip, which you must choose from the abjuration or evocation schools
Knowledge of Weapon Bond
Ability to cast cantrips using bonus action if you used your action to attack with a two-handed melee weapon for that turn

entries: After reading, the writings will diminish for one hundred years.

item.name: Identifier Machine
entries: A contraption with a huge pearl on the right side and a hemisphere cavity on the left side. Between the two, numerous lenses and prisms are inlaid. The cavity is surfaced with polished adamantine. Whenever a magical item is brought close to the cavity, the pearl shines with the color of the specific magic school. The pearl's brightness points to the intensity of the magic.
You can expend a spell slot to infuse the machine with your magic to "{@spell identify|PHB}" the item.

item.name: Beggar's Delight
entries: Enchanted by a wizard who was sick of eating their spouse's cooking. This fork tingles in your hand when picked up.

When you use this fork to eat, you may think of any food begore taking a bite, the food on the fork takes the smell and tastes of what you are thinking of. Should the food on your fork have any poison in it, the fork magically melts in your hand.

item.name: Rat Statuette
entries: A rat statuette. The rat is posed standing up, trying to smell something.
If you lick it, roll a Performance check. On a success, you gain the ability to change your voice to someone you have heard before.

entries.name: Curse
entries: If you pay for this statuette willingly, you are cursed.
As soon as you start fiddling with it, the statuette animates and bites you.
When bitten you are affected with {@spell bane|PHB} and the rat runs away.
To get rid of the curse, you must find the rat, petrify it back to a statuette and sell it.
For the curse to transfer to another, the creature buying it must pay at least 1 copper piece for it.

item.name: Azuth Pearl Earring
item.reqAttune: by a spellcaster with a limited number of spells known
entries: During a long rest, you can take 1 hour to read a spell to the earring. The earring will memorise it and remind you if you ever need to.
The number of spells you know increases by 1.
You can cast the spell memorised by the earring once every day without expending a spell slot.
You have a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls.

item.name: Earring of Whispers
entries: While attuned to this earring, you can use an action to send a telepathic message to another creature with another earring of whispers attuned similar to the {@spell sending|PHB} spell with the exceptions:

items: You can send up to ten words.
You cannot send messages across planes.
Using this item does not require visual, somatic, or material components.
Using this item requires concentration for 1 turn.

item.name: Brass Centipede
entries: When you attune to this statuette of a brass centipede, it animates and crawls into your ear. The centipede nests inside your brain, creating an extra alter ego for you to expand your mind and concentrate for you. You can concentrate on 2 spells at the same time.

entries.name: Curse
entries: You have to fend for two minds at the same time. You have disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom and, Charisma saving throws.
You need surgical tools and a surgeon to remove this centipede from your brain without killing yourself.

item.name: Companion Coin
entries: This coin creates an unbreakable magic link with a single creature when they drop a drip of blood upon it. Once linked, their name is magically inscribed on the blank side. When the coin is flipped and untouched until landing, it shows the following:

items: If it lands with the skull face up, they are dying or in a life threatening position.
If it lands with their name side face up, they're in no danger and doing okay.
If the coin lands on its edge, they are dead.

item.name: Horn of Vulgrim
entries: This is the broken horn of Vulgrim the demonic merchant. You can blow it to call him from anywhere and he will humbly answer your call.

When summoned, a glyph portal will open at the nearest square to the summoner. Any creature overlapping with the portal must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.
He also accepts souls as payment.
Vulgrim's twisted mind spins with so many detestable schemes that I doubt he even trusts himself. If this wretched demon's business is collecting souls, his pleasure is devouring them.
Always ravenous, Vulgrim will beg, steal or kill for souls. He has also been known to trade for them. A desperate warrior might find such a black bargain palatable.

item.name: Skinner's Tools
entries: Each toolkit contains 3 skinning knifes with different shpaes, a whetstone, two sets of hempen rope (25 feet long), a flask of oil, and 1 lb of salt. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to skin or harvest creatures.
additionalEntries: Being used by hunters and adventurers, skinner's tools are designed for salvaging creatures. Proficiency with the tools also grants you a general knowledge of anatomy.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: Thieves' tools contains 3 skinning knifes with different shpaes, a whetstone, two sets of hempen rope (25 feet long), a flask of oil, and 1 lb of salt.

additionalEntries.name: Nature and Survival.
entries: When you travel in the wild, your skill in skinning makes it easier to identify creatures and guess what kind of materials you can harvest from them.

additionalEntries.name: Investigation and Perception
entries: You gain additional insight to notice deviations and oddities of creatures.

additionalEntries.name: Handle Poison
entries: Your proficiency allows you to extract and handle a poison without risk of exposing yourself to its effects.
